options.text: To deploy Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub with Terraform, visit the following link to get started

Select the architecture setup for the Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub. You can select if you want to deploy a single hub into a single region, or create multiple hubs across multiple regions using API Management for load balancing and distribution of traffic.

elements.name: aiDeployOption
elements.label: Intent of deployment
elements.defaultDescription: Select the intent for this deployment.

allowedValues.label: Production
allowedValues.description: Deploy Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub into a production environment.

allowedValues.label: Proof of Concept
allowedValues.description: This option will allow you to enable Preview features such as multi-region setup and deploy sample applications if you want to start with a Use Case.

elements.name: aiIntention
elements.label: Regional setup
elements.defaultValue: Deploy to a single Azure region
elements.defaultDescription: Select the architecture for this deployment.

allowedValues.label: Deploy to a single Azure region
allowedValues.description: Deploy Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub with optional services into a single Azure region.

allowedValues.label: Deploy to multiple Azure regions
allowedValues.description: Deploy Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub across multiple Azure regions, using APIM for load balancing with retry and error handling.

options.text: For Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub in a multi-region setup, all Azure services will be configured using Public Endpoints. Private Endpoint support for both PoC and Production deployment will be enabled soon.

Currently Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub can only be deployed to a single Azure region supporting Private Endpoints. Support for multi-region setup with Private Endpoints will be enabled soon. To deploy to multiple Azure regions using Public Endpoints, select 'Proof of Concept' option in the drop down.

elements.name: aiMultiLocation
elements.label: Select the additional Azure region for the Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub
elements.toolTip: Select the additional Azure region for the Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub

elements.name: apimLocation
elements.label: Select the Azure region for the API Management (V2 Preview)
elements.toolTip: Select the supported Azure region for the API Management (V2 Preview) service that will be created.

options.text: Centralizing storage of application secrets in Azure Key Vault allows you to control their distribution. Key Vault greatly reduces the chances that secrets may be accidentally leaked. When application developers use Key Vault, they no longer need to store security information in their application. Use Azure Key Vault to enable Customer-Managed keys scenarios for Azure OpenAI workload compositions

elements.name: kvSoftDeleteRetention
elements.label: Soft Delete Retention (in days)
elements.toolTip: Select soft delete retention days for Key Vaults. Default is 30 days.

allowedValues.label: No, use local authorization with Vault access policies

elements.name: kvMonCreation
elements.label: Enable Diagnostic Settings for logging and threat detection

options.text: The VNet and subnet you select can be in a different Azure region then the Private Endpoint for Key Vault. Ensure you have connectivity to the other services you are creating.

Note you are creating the Private Endpoint into a different Azure Region then the Key Vault. Ensure you have connectivity with the other Azure services you are creating in case their Private Endpoints are in different regions and Virtual Networks

elements.name: kvKeyCreation
elements.label: Use Customer-Managed Keys to encrypt data for the Azure services

options.text: Bring your own storage that you can use to train Azure OpenAI on internal, highly confidential data fully encrypted by Customer-Managed Keys.

elements.name: stEncryptionSection
elements.label: Encryption in transit and at rest Settings

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-15 characters long.

options.text: The VNet and subnet you select can be in a different Azure region then the Private Endpoint for Storage Account. Ensure you have connectivity to the other services you are creating.

Note you are creating the Private Endpoint into a different Azure Region then the Storage Account. Ensure you have connectivity with the other Azure services you are creating in case their Private Endpoints are in different regions and Virtual Networks

elements.name: stMonCreation
elements.label: Enable Diagnostic Settings for logging and threat detection

options.text: Azure OpenAI Service provides REST API access to OpenAI's powerful language models including the GPT-4, GPT-35-Turbo, and Embeddings model series. In addition, the new GPT-4 and gpt-35-turbo model series have now reached general availability. These models can be easily adapted to your specific task including but not limited to content generation, summarization, semantic search, and natural language to code translation. Users can access the service through REST APIs, Python SDK, or our web-based interface in the Azure OpenAI Studio.

elements.name: aiEncryptionSection
elements.label: Encryption in transit and at rest Settings

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-15 characters long.

elements.name: aiRestrictOutboundNetworkAccess
elements.label: Restric Outbound Network Access for Azure OpenAI

options.text: The VNet and subnet you select can be in a different Azure region then the Private Endpoint for Azure OpenAI service. Ensure you have connectivity to the other services you are creating.

Note you are creating the Private Endpoint into a different Azure Region then the Azure OpenAI service. Ensure you have connectivity with the other Azure services you are creating in case their Private Endpoints are in different regions and Virtual Networks

allowedValues.label: No, use local authorization with API key

elements.name: aiSystemIdentity
elements.label: Enable Managed Identity (System-assigned) for Azure OpenAI
elements.toolTip: When enabling Managed Identity and usage of Customer-Managed keys, this identity will have RBAC permission to retrieve the associated Key Vault secret.

elements.name: aiMonCreation
elements.label: Enable Diagnostic Settings for logging and threat detection

options.text: Deployments provide endpoints to the Azure OpenAI base models, or your fine-tuned models, configured with settings to meet your needs, including the content moderation model, version handling, and deployment size. From this page, you can create new deployments.
Azure OpenAI Service is powered by a diverse set of models with different capabilities and price points. Model availability varies by region.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-10 characters long.

elements.name: aiModelVersion
elements.label: Select the Model you want to deploy
elements.defaultDescription: Select the models you want to deploy to you Azure OpenAI service

allowedValues.label: GPT-4o
allowedValues.description: Use the latest multi-modal model from GPT with support for images, text, speach, and video. GPT-4o is a large multimodal model (LMM) developed by OpenAI that can analyze images and provide textual responses to questions about them. It incorporates both natural language processing and visual understanding. The GPT-4o model answers general questions about what's present in the images. You can also show it video if you use Vision enhancement.

allowedValues.label: GPT-4
allowedValues.description: GPT-4 can solve difficult problems with greater accuracy than any of OpenAI's previous models. Like GPT-3.5 Turbo, GPT-4 is optimized for chat and works well for traditional completions tasks. Use the Chat Completions API to use GPT-4.

allowedValues.label: GPT-4-32k
allowedValues.description: GPT-4 can solve difficult problems with greater accuracy than any of OpenAI's previous models. Like GPT-3.5 Turbo, GPT-4 is optimized for chat and works well for traditional completions tasks. Use the Chat Completions API to use GPT-4.

allowedValues.label: GPT-4-Vision
allowedValues.description: GPT-4 Turbo with Vision is a large multimodal model (LMM) developed by OpenAI that can analyze images and provide textual responses to questions about them. It incorporates both natural language processing and visual understanding.The GPT-4 Turbo with Vision model answers general questions about what's present in the images. You can also show it video if you use Vision enhancement.

allowedValues.label: Embeddings
allowedValues.description: OpenAI offers a powerful second-generation embedding model (denoted by -002 in the model ID). Its better, cheaper, and simpler to use than previous embeddings models.

allowedValues.label: GPT-35-Turbo
allowedValues.description: GPT-3.5 models can understand and generate natural language or code. The most capable and cost effective model in the GPT-3.5 family is GPT-3.5 Turbo, which has been optimized for chat and works well for traditional completions tasks as well.

allowedValues.label: GPT-35-Turbo-16k
allowedValues.description: GPT-3.5 models can understand and generate natural language or code. The most capable and cost effective model in the GPT-3.5 family is GPT-3.5 Turbo, which has been optimized for chat and works well for traditional completions tasks as well.

options.text: The default content filtering configuration is set to filter at the medium severity threshold for all four content harms categories for both, prompts and completions. This means that content that is detected at severity level medium or high is filtered, while content detected at severity level low is not filtered by the content filters. Customers are responsible for ensuring that applications integrating Azure OpenAI comply with the Code of Conduct.

options.text: Enable additional content safety models that can be run on top of the main content filters. These models are optional.

allowedValues.label: Yes
allowedValues.description: An AI model that detects jailbreak attempts, a user interaction strategy that gets the model to bypass desired behavior that was set by the model developer in order to violate content policies or safety policies originally set. Runs on prompts.

allowedValues.label: No
allowedValues.description: The model will not detect jailbreak attempts.

allowedValues.label: Yes
allowedValues.description: A model that helps detect and protect against regurgitation of language that matches known text content (e.g song lyrics, articles, recipes, selected web content). Runs on completions.

allowedValues.label: No
allowedValues.description: The model will not detect and protect against regurgitation of language that matches known text content.

allowedValues.label: Yes
allowedValues.description: A model that helps detect source code that matches a set of source code from public repositories, and provide example citation and license information in annotations. Runs on completions.

allowedValues.label: No
allowedValues.description: The model will not detect ource code that matches a set of source code from public repositories, and provide example citation and license information in annotations.

options.text: Subject to your initial use cases, you can enable additional Azure services for the complete Enterprise Azure OpenAI Hub architecture on Azure.

Technology is advancing at an unprecedented pace, and businesses are seeking innovative ways to maintain a competitive edge. Nowhere is this truer than in the realms of generative AI. From generating realistic images and videos to enhancing customer experiences, generative AI has proven to be a versatile tool across various industries.

elements.name: aiUseCaseDeployment
elements.label: Create required Azure services for the initial use cases

elements.name: aiUseCaseSelection
elements.label: Select the initial use case you want to deploy
elements.defaultDescription: Select the initial use case you want to start with.

allowedValues.label: Image and video recognition
allowedValues.description: Analyze images and provide textual responses to questions about them. It incorporates both natural language processing and visual understanding.

allowedValues.label: 'On Your Data'
allowedValues.description: Empowers your organization to leverage the power of OpenAI models, such as GPT-4, and incorporates the advanced capabilities of RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) model, directly on your data with enterprise-grade security on Azure.

allowedValues.label: 'Patient Referral'
allowedValues.description: Analyze healthcare referral documents using the power of OpenAI models, such as GPT-4, directly on your data with enterprise-grade security on Azure.

allowedValues.label: AI Assistant for videos (Preview)
allowedValues.description: Extract key insights and identify scenes suited for short video clip generation for social media, using Azure Video Indexer and Azure OpenAI Assistant (Preview) APIs

options.text: To support the initial use case, additional Azure OpenAI model deployments will be created.

elements.name: aiSampleAppSection
elements.label: Sample Web App for 'On Your Data' use case (Optional)

options.text: The sample Web App enables your organization to quickly validate and explore ChatGPT on your own business data. To integrated with Entra ID for authentication, you can create a new Application Registration now with a client secret, or do it post deployment by following the documentation.

elements.name: aiSampleAppDeployment
elements.label: Deploy sample Web App for 'On Your Data' use case

toolTip.password: Provide the application secret as it will be used to authenticate with Azure AD

elements.name: aiAddVisionSection
elements.label: Required services for the 'Image and video recognition' use case

elements.name: aiAddOnYouDataSection
elements.label: Required services for the 'On Your Data' use case

options.text: For using Azure OpenAI in the same Azure region while getting additional quota and capacity, it is recommended to deploy into separate Azure subscriptions to avoid the capacity is shared.

elements.name: aiAddEmbeddingInstance
elements.label: Create a dedicated Azure OpenAI instance to orchestrate index creation and generate embeddings in AI Search

elements.name: aiDedicatedSection
elements.label: Dedicated Azure OpenAI instance for index and embeddings

options.text: Select the additional subscription that will be used for the dedicated Azure OpenAI instance to orchestrate indexes and generate embeddings to AI Search.

elements.name: aiDedicatedSubnetId
elements.label: ResourceId of existing subnet in the additional subscription for connecting Private Endpoint

options.text: Azure AI Search, an AI-powered information retrieval platform, helps developers build rich search experiences and generative AI apps that combine large language models with enterprise data. Implement search functionality for any mobile or search application within your organization or as part of software as a service (SaaS) apps.

elements.name: aiSearchReplicas
elements.label: Replicas distribute workloads across the service
elements.toolTip: Replicas distribute workloads across the service. We guarantee 99.9% availability for read operations with 2 replicas, and for read and write operations with 3 or more replicas.

elements.name: aiSearchPartitions
elements.label: Partitions allow for scaling of document counts
elements.toolTip: Partitions allow for scaling of document counts as well as faster data ingestion by spanning your index over multiple units.

options.text: The VNet and subnet you select can be in a different Azure region then the Private Endpoint for Azure AI search. Ensure you have connectivity to the other services you are creating.

Note you are creating the Private Endpoint into a different Azure Region then Azure AI Search. Ensure you have connectivity with the other Azure services you are creating in case their Private Endpoints are in different regions and Virtual Networks

To allow access to your Azure AI Search resource from Azure OpenAI resource, you need to submit an application form. The application will be reviewed in 10 business days and you will be contacted via email about the results. If you are eligible, we will provision the private endpoint in Microsoft managed virtual network, and send a private endpoint connection request to your search service, and you will need to approve the request.

allowedValues.label: No, use local authorization with API key

elements.name: aiSearchSystemIdentity
elements.label: Enable Managed Identity (System-assigned) for Azure AI Search
elements.toolTip: When enabling Managed Identity and usage of Customer-Managed keys, this identity will have RBAC permission access the Azure OpenAI instance.

elements.name: aiSearchMonCreation
elements.label: Enable Diagnostic Settings for logging and threat detection

elements.name: aiAddServicesSectionVision
elements.label: Required services for the selected use case

options.text: Azure AI Vision is a unified service that offers innovative computer vision capabilities. Give your apps the ability to analyze images, read text, and detect faces with prebuilt image tagging, text extraction with optical character recognition (OCR), and responsible facial recognition. Incorporate vision features into your projects with no machine learning experience required.

elements.name: aiVisionRestrictOutboundNetworkAccess
elements.label: Restric Outbound Network Access for AI Vision

options.text: The VNet and subnet you select can be in a different Azure region then the Private Endpoint for AI Vision. Ensure you have connectivity to the other services you are creating.

Note you are creating the Private Endpoint into a different Azure Region then AI Vision. Ensure you have connectivity with the other Azure services you are creating in case their Private Endpoints are in different regions and Virtual Networks

elements.toolTip: When enabling Managed Identity and usage of Customer-Managed keys, this identity will have RBAC permission access the Azure OpenAI instance.

elements.name: aiAddServicesSectionVideoIndexer
elements.label: Required services for the selected use case

options.text: Azure AI Video Indexer is a cloud application, part of Azure AI services, built on Azure AI services (such as the Face, Translator, Azure AI Vision, and Speech). It enables you to extract the insights from your videos using Azure AI Video Indexer video and audio models.

options.text: Azure AI Document Intelligence enables you to effectively manage the velocity at which data is collected and processed and is key to improved operations, informed data-driven decisions, and enlightened innovation.

elements.name: aiDocLocation
elements.label: Select the Azure region for the Document Intelligence with the required API version
elements.toolTip: Select the supported Azure region for the Document Intelligence with the required API version.

elements.name: aiAddServicesSectionOnYourData
elements.label: Required services for the selected use case

options.text: Azure Cosmos DB is a globally distributed, multi-model database service and offered by Microsoft. It is designed to provide high availability, scalability, and low-latency access to data for modern applications. Cosmos DB is used to persist prompt results as part of the index pipelines provided by Azure Data Factory.
The VNet and subnet you select can be in a different Azure region then the Private Endpoint for Cosmos DB. Ensure you have connectivity to the other services you are creating.

Note you are creating the Private Endpoint into a different Azure Region then Cosmos DB. Ensure you have connectivity with the other Azure services you are creating in case their Private Endpoints are in different regions and Virtual Networks

allowedValues.label: No, use local authorization with API key

elements.name: cosmosSystemIdentity
elements.label: Enable Managed Identity (System-assigned) for Cosmos DB
elements.toolTip: When enabling Managed Identity, this identity will have RBAC permission access the Azure OpenAI instance.

elements.name: cosmosMonCreation
elements.label: Enable Diagnostic Settings for logging and threat detection

elements.name: aiAddServicesSectionOnYourData
elements.label: Required services for the selected use case

options.text: Azure Data Factory is a cloud-based data integration service that allows you to create, schedule, and orchestrate data pipelines for moving and transforming data between different data stores. In this setup Data Factory will provide pipelines for index creation in Azure AI Search for RAG based use cases.
The VNet and subnet you select can be in a different Azure region then the Private Endpoint for Data Factory. Ensure you have connectivity to the other services you are creating.

Note you are creating the Private Endpoint into a different Azure Region then Data Factory. Ensure you have connectivity with the other Azure services you are creating in case their Private Endpoints are in different regions and Virtual Networks

elements.name: dfSystemIdentity

elements.toolTip: When enabling Managed Identity, this identity will have RBAC permission access the Azure OpenAI instance.

elements.label: Enable Diagnostic Settings for logging and threat detection
